alert.note: Alert for Creek; Osage; Pawnee; Tulsa; Washington (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued April 02 at 2:10PM CDT until April 04 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...DANGEROUS FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS EXPECTED TUESDAY AFTERNOON... .Very dry and windy conditions will develop across parts of northeast Oklahoma Tuesday afternoon as a dry line moves into the area. The most dangerous conditions are expected to remain to the west of U.S. Highway 75, where several wildfires have occurred recently and may still be ongoing at that time. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING FOR VERY DRY AND WINDY CONDITIONS FOR PARTS OF NORTHEAST OKLAHOMA... The National Weather Service in Tulsa has issued a Fire Weather Watch, which is in effect from Tuesday afternoon through Tuesday evening. * AFFECTED AREA...IN Oklahoma, Osage, Washington, Pawnee, Tulsa, and Creek counties. * WIND...Southwest 20 to 30 mph, with gusts as high as 50 mph. * HUMIDITY...Minimum humidity 15 to 25 percent. * TEMPERATURE...Max temperatures mid to upper 80s. * IMPACTS...any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A fire weather watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur.
